commenter_a: the problem with this story is this....the young girl was NOT directing her comment at anyone but the shirt itself. I am a larger sized woman and have done the same thing when I found clothes that were super large. It's not a slight to those who are larger than me and I'm sure it wasn't meant that way by this girl. If you are that sensitive by your size, then stay at home or do something about it. I have been called names my whole life because I'm not a size 2 or even a size 12. What others think of my size is none of my business. If they allow my "size" determine whether they want to know me or not, I don't care. It's their loss. I'm pretty freakin' awesome once you get to know me. I like me.
